Raw Material Extraction and Processing.description: Extraction and processing of aluminum, rare earth elements, and other materials required for iPhone 13 Pro production.
Raw Material Extraction and Processing.rationale: Essential for sourcing primary materials needed for phone manufacturing.

Production of Intermediate Materials.description: Processing materials to create components like the A15 Bionic chip and Super Retina XDR display.
Production of Intermediate Materials.rationale: Necessary for obtaining functional parts of the device.

Recycling Processes.description: Processing recycled aluminum and rare earth elements for use in the product.
Recycling Processes.rationale: Supports Apple's sustainability practices by reducing dependence on new raw materials.

Transport to Manufacturer.description: Transporting raw and intermediate materials to the manufacturing plant.
Transport to Manufacturer.rationale: Critical step in getting necessary materials to production facilities.

Manufacturing of Product.description: Assembly of the iPhone 13 Pro, including all components and quality checks.
Manufacturing of Product.rationale: Core activity for producing the final product.

Transport to User.description: Shipping of finished products to distributors, retailers, and directly to consumers.
Transport to User.rationale: Facilitates availability of the product for consumption.

N/A.rationale: Installation stage is not applicable as the iPhone is a consumer good usually self-installed.

Use of Product.description: Operation of the iPhone by users, including app usage and communication functions.
Use of Product.rationale: Encompasses everyday functioning and user experience.

Maintenance of Product.description: Software updates and battery health management.
Maintenance of Product.rationale: Ensures optimal performance and security of the device.

Repair of Product.description: Replacement of broken screens or battery replacements.
Repair of Product.rationale: Necessary for prolonging the life span of the device.

Replacement.description: Replacing old devices when upgrading to a new model.
Replacement.rationale: Part of the consumer lifecycle when opting for newer models.

N/A.rationale: Refurbishment is usually conducted by Apple itself not the end user.

Energy Use.description: Electricity consumption during charging and use.
Energy Use.rationale: Represents the energy footprint during the phone's operational lifetime.

Water Use.rationale: Water use is typically insignificant in the direct operation of an electronic device like an iPhone.

De-installation.description: Consumer's separation of the device from use at the end of its life.
De-installation.rationale: Necessary preparation for disposal or recycling.

Transport to Waste Processing.description: Shipping old devices to recycling or disposal facilities.

Waste Processing.description: Recycling materials like aluminum and glass from the device.
Waste Processing.rationale: Maximizes recovery and minimizes environmental impact.

Disposal.rationale: Essential for ensuring environmentally responsible end-of-life management.
